issues.description: Hero CTA may lack urgency signal for '48 hours' promise - no countdown or time-sensitive messaging
issues.rationale: 48-hour promise needs reinforcement at decision point to drive immediate action vs later consideration

issues.description: Audit log pattern may confuse users about what they're viewing - unclear if demo or real data
issues.rationale: Users need clear context about preview vs actual functionality to avoid abandonment after signup

issues.description: Sticky CTA appears at 40% scroll but pricing at bottom - long gap without conversion option
issues.rationale: Users may lose momentum in middle sections without persistent conversion path visibility

issues.description: Problem-solution merge may bury key pain points that drive urgency for immediate action
issues.rationale: Condensing problem articulation risks losing emotional hook that motivates 48-hour urgency

issues.description: Pricing cards lack risk reversal messaging - no trial, guarantee, or cancellation clarity
issues.rationale: High-commitment pricing without safety net increases hesitation at final conversion moment

issues.description: Visibility panel component may create repetitive experience without progressive disclosure
issues.rationale: Repeated identical trust signals can feel marketing-heavy rather than progressively building confidence

issues.description: Proof bar placement above fold may push hero CTA below fold on smaller desktop screens
issues.rationale: Adding content above CTA risks burying primary conversion action on constrained viewports

issues.description: 65ch line length may be too wide for mobile scanning - optimal mobile is 45-50ch
issues.rationale: Wide text blocks reduce mobile readability and increase cognitive load during quick evaluation

issues.description: 8px button radius may feel too soft for business tool - could signal consumer app vs professional
issues.rationale: Professional users expect sharper, more precise visual language that signals business capability

issues.description: Accordion comparison matrix may hide key differentiators that drive tier selection decisions
issues.rationale: Hidden comparison features increase cognitive load and may lead to suboptimal tier choices
